cip.render.raytrace.geometry

Class Sphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AGeometry
      • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.Sphere
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtGeometry
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ellipsoid

    public class Sphere
extends AGeometry
    This is the implementation of a sphere of some radius centered at 0,0,0 in the object coordinate system.

    There are methods to programmatically initialize a sphere, but, it is most common to load the sphere from a scene description file. The sphere is specified as a node in an XML scene description file as: 

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.Sphere" name="sphereName">
         <radius>radius</radius>
         <MaterialByRef name="materialName"/>
         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="materialClass">
               .
             material specific nodes and attributes
               .
         </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    where:
    radius The radius of the sphere. The default radius is 1 if not specified.
    MaterialByRef A material specified by reference to the name of a previously loaded material. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.
    DynamicallyLoadedObject The specification fof a material for the sphere. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.

    Example of XML Specification

    The following specifies a sphere of radius 5:

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.Sphere" name="sphere">
         <radius>5</radius>
         <MaterialByRef name="blue"/>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    Since:
    1.0

        public void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                        @Nullable
                        @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        The geometry implementation must override this function to load the geometry from the XML node.
        Specified by:
        loadFromXml in interface IDynXmlObject
        Overrides:
        loadFromXml in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.

      • internalToXml

        protected void internalToXml(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        Override this function to add object-specific information to an XML node.
        Overrides:
        internalToXml in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        element - The dynamically loaded object node that the object-specific information should be written into. The AGeometry.loadFromXml(org.w3c.dom.Element, LinkedList) funtcion must be overridden by the geometry implementation to be able to read the object-specific information set by the object here.

        Returns true since a sphere is convex.
        Specified by:
        isConvex in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        isConvex in class AGeometry
        Returns:
        Returns true if the object is convex and false if the object is not convex or the convexity cannot be verified.

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(Point3f pt)
        Description copied from interface: IRtGeometry
        Tests whether a point is inside ot outside the geometry. This might be interesting, for example, for a travelling camera that ystal ball.
        Parameters:
        pt - (readonly) The point to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside the geometry, false otherwise.

      • getConvexHullVertices

        public Point3f[] getConvexHullVertices()
        Returns an array of 24 points that are the vertices of a convex hull described by a min-max box with the corners trimmed by planes that are perpendicular to the diagonals of the 8 quadrants of a 3D axis system.
        Specified by:
        getConvexHullVertices in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        getConvexHullVertices in class AGeometry
        Returns:
        Returns the array of convex hull vertices, Returns null if a convex hull cannot be fit to the object. Being unable to fit a convex hull implies that the object must be explicitly queried for intersection on every ray.

      • getRayIntersection

        public boolean getRayIntersection(RayIntersection intersection,
                                  Line3f ray,
                                  boolean bStartsInside,
                                  int nSample,
                                  int nRandom)
        Tests a ray for an intersection with a sphere. See IRtGeometry description of getRayIntersection().
        Specified by:
        getRayIntersection in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        getRayIntersection in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The intersection of the ray and the surface. The intersection will be either freshly initialized or will contain information about the closest intersection discovered thus far.
        ray - The ray being tesed for intersection.
        bStartsInside - false if this is an outside ray, true if this is a ray spawned from an intersection with this object and on the inside of the object.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index..
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is an intersection with this object that is closer than the current intersection, and false otherwise.

      • getNaturalCoordinates

        public void getNaturalCoordinates(RayIntersection intersection)
        The natural mapping for a sphere is U equal to degrees longitude measured counter-clockwise (looking down) starting at the +i axis being 0 degree (+j = 90 degree, -i = 180 degree, and -j = 270 degree). And V being latitude in degrees starting at -90 degrees for -k, and +90 degree for +k. The Sphere does not compute natural coordinates unless they are specifically requested using this function.
        Specified by:
        getNaturalCoordinates in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        getNaturalCoordinates in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The ray intersection.

      • testShadow

        public boolean testShadow(RayIntersection intersection,
                          Vector3f vLight,
                          float fDistLight,
                          IRtLight light,
                          int nSample,
                          int nRandom)
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        The default implementation returns false, that there is no cast shadow.
        Specified by:
        testShadow in interface IRtGeometry
        Overrides:
        testShadow in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        intersection - The intersection being tested for shadow.
        vLight - The direction from the intersection to the light.
        fDistLight - The distance from the intersection to the light.
        light - The light. This is supplied as an argument in the event an object is both a light source and a geometry and the geometry of the light should not be tested for casting a shadow from that light.
        nSample - The pixel sub-sample index. This is used in distributed ray-tracing to make sure the correct sample displacement is used for samples that are distributed.
        nRandom - The jitter array index.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this object casts a shadow from the light and false otherwise.
